articles.title: Kim Jong Il Provides Field Guidance to Salmon Breeding Institute
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Provides Field Guidance to Salmon Breeding Institute
Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave on-site guidance to the Salmon Breeding Institute.
					 He made the rounds of an artificial insemination room, a room for spawn growth, a laboratory, a feed processing room and other places of the institute to acquaint himself in detail with its construction and researches there.
					
					 After going round the interior and exterior of the neatly-built institute, he noted that the institute stands in a good place and has been well built as required by the new century. And he highly estimated the laudable feats performed by soldier-builders, expressing his great satisfaction over the fact that they have successfully built the modern fish breeding institute in a matter of one year.
					
					 Seeing the research processes equipped with ultra-modern facilities and shoals of young salmons in each breeding pond at the institute, he was very pleased to learn that its employees opened up a bright prospect of breeding salmon in a big way. He praised them for having done a lot of work. 
					
					 The party members and other working people of the institute are front rankers in the drive for self-reliance and ardent patriots as they have created everything from nothing and devoted themselves to the development and prosperity of the country, he said, urging all other units to earnestly learn from their revolutionary and go-ahead work style. 
					
					 He advanced highly important tasks to be carried out by the institute.
					
					 He said that to actively conserve and propagate marine resources is a noble patriotic work for developing the national economy and improving the people's standard of living by increasing the production of marine products.
					
					 He said that salmon is a species suitable for fish breeding which makes it possible to mass-produce high quality fish with less feed as it is not only tasty but grows itself in sea waters after the release of fries.
					
					 Our country has favorable conditions for salmon breeding as it has many rivers and lakes and is surrounded by seas, he said, underscoring the need to bring about a fresh turn in the salmon breeding by conducting it in a big way under an ambitious plan.
					
					 He said that in order to increase the production of salmons it is necessary to find out all places good for the ecological environment of salmon for the purpose of building more salmon breeding farms and, at the same time, put its breeding on an industrial, scientific and organized basis.
					
					 He underlined the need to pay deep attention to arranging river-beds so that salmons may move freely.
					
					 Noting that it is necessary to take in advance measures for processing salmons in keeping with the expected increase in the salmon production, he underscored the need for the breeding farms to have in place equipment enough to produce a variety of processed salmon such as canned salmon and canned salmon roe.
					
					 He earnestly called on all sectors and units to continue pushing ahead with the fish breeding in an effort to rapidly boost the production of freshwater fish and provide people with greater quantities of tasty and nutritious salmon in the era of the Workers' Party.
					
					 He was accompanied by Secretaries Choe Thae Bok and Kim Ki Nam, Department Director Jang Song Thaek and First Vice Department Director Ri Je Gang of the WPK Central Committee and Generals of the Korean People's Army Hyon Chol Hae and Ri Myong Su.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets WCC Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets WCC Delegation 
 Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the  Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had a talk with the delegation of the World Council of Churches led by General Secretary Samuel Kobia at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Monday.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from General Secretary of WCC
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from General Secretary of WCC
 Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by General Secretary of the World Council of Churches Samuel Kobia on a visit to the DPRK. 
					 The gift was conveyed to President of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly Kim Yong Nam by the general secretary on Monday.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il Congratulates to Greek PM
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il Congratulates to Greek PM 
Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Kim Yong Il sent a congratulatory message to George Papandreou on his appointment as Prime Minister of Greece on Monday.
					Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two peoples would further develop, he wished the Prime Minister success in his work for the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Congratulates to Director-General of UNESCO
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Congratulates to Director-General of UNESCO
 Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- Pak Ui Chun, minister of Foreign Affairs, sent a congratulatory message to Irina Gueorguieva Bokova upon her election as director-general of UNESCO at the 35th session of its General Conference on October 16.
					 The message wished Irina success in her responsible work, expressing belief that the cooperative relations between the DPRK and UNESCO would grow stronger.

articles.title: Agreement between DPRK and Russian City Signed
articles.content:
Agreement between DPRK and Russian City Signed
 Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- An agreement on establishing the sister city relations between Wonsan City and Vladivostok City and boosting the friendship and cooperation between them was signed in Wonsan City on Monday. 
					 Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were Hong Son Ok, vice-chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who is chairwoman of the DPRK-Russia Friendship Association, Ri Il Sop, chairman of the Wonsan City People's Committee, and officials concerned and from the Russian side the Vladivostok City delegation of the Russian Federation led by Mayor Igor Pushkarev and Alexander Matsegora, minister-councilor of the Russian embassy here.

articles.title: Vladivostok City Photo Exhibition and Ceremony of Donating Books Held
articles.content:
Vladivostok City Photo Exhibition and Ceremony of Donating Books Held
 Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- A Vladivostok City photo exhibition and a ceremony of donating books took place at the Fine Art Exhibition in Kangwon Province on Monday on the occasion of the signing of the agreement on establishing the sister city relations between Wonsan City of the DPRK and Vladivostok City of Russia and boosting the friendship and cooperation between them.
					 Present there were Hong Son Ok, vice-chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who is chairwoman of the DPRK-Russia Friendship Association, Ri Il Sop, chairman of the Wonsan City People's Committee, officials concerned and working people in Wonsan City and the Vladivostok City delegation of Russia headed by Mayor Igor Pushkarev and Alexander Matsegora, minister-councilor of the Russian embassy here.
					
					 After speeches were made, the participants looked round the photos on Vladivostok City.
					
					 Then Russian books were donated to Wonsan University of Agriculture.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Vladivostok City Delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Vladivostok City Delegation
 Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the Vladivostok City delegation of the Russian Federation on a visit to the DPRK. 
					 The gift was conveyed to an official concerned by Igor Pushkarev, mayor of the city who is heading the delegation.

articles.title: DPRK, China Sign 2010 Sports Exchange Protocol
articles.content:
DPRK, China Sign 2010 Sports Exchange Protocol
 Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- A 2010 sports exchange protocol was signed between the Physical Culture and Sports Guidance Commission of the DPRK and the General Administration of Sports of China on October 17 in China.
					 Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were the members of the delegation of the Physical Culture and Sports Guidance Commission of the DPRK headed by Chairman Pak Hak Son and from the Chinese side officials concerned including Minister of the General Administration of Sports of China Liu Peng.
					
					 The protocol was inked by Pak Hak Son and Liu Peng.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Il Sung from Chinese Youth League Committee
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Il Sung from Chinese Youth League Committee
 Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung was presented with a gift by the Beijing Municipal Committee of the Communist Youth League of China. 
					 It was handed to an official concerned Monday by Jiang Zeting, vice-secretary of the above-said committee, on a visit to the DPRK.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Youth League Committee
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Youth League Committee
 Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the Beijing Municipal Committee of the Communist Youth League of China.
					 It was handed to an official concerned Monday by Jiang Zeting, vice-secretary of the above-said committee, on a visit to the DPRK.

articles.title: Exhibition of Scientific and Technological Achievements in Health Held
articles.content:
Exhibition of Scientific and Technological Achievements in Health Held
 Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- The 12th national exhibition of scientific and technological achievements in the field of public health was held at the Three-Revolution Exhibition in Pyongyang some time ago.
					 On display there were lots of data, medical appliances and medicines presented by officials, scientists and technicians of health institutions at all levels of the capital and the provinces.
					
					 Appreciated there were "Phaedok Capsule" (a cold remedy), "Hepatitis C Antibody Diagnosis Reagent" and others exhibited by the Academy of Medical Science.
					
					 The valuable data on invention and new technological achievements exhibited by Pyongyang University of Medicine drew interests of the visitors for their efficacy in prevention, treatment and diagnosis of diseases.
					
					 In particular, natural medicine "Phasok Capsule" produced by the Korea Jangsaeng J.V. Company won popularity among the visitors for its efficacy in the cure of nephrolithiasis and cholelithiasis.
					
					 A scientific and technological presentation, information service and other events were held during the exhibition. 
					
					 The exhibition did much toward giving full play to the superiority of socialist health system and to developing the nation's medical science and technology.

articles.title: New Books Issued
articles.content:
New Books Issued
 Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Publishing House has recently brought out the book "Old Artists of Our Nation" and full-length novel "Even If I Became a Decayed Tree".
					 The book "Old Artists of Our Nation" introduces old artists who created famous art pieces showing the history of the Korean nation.
					
					 Carried in the book are some pictures associated with the wisdom and energy of old artists.
					
					 The novel "Even If I Became a Decayed Tree" with a patriot for reunification as a hero impressively tells  about the struggle of hero Pang Ok Se and his sweetheart Song Ran Hui who are devoting their youth to the sacred cause of reunifying the divided country.
					
					 The books are popular among the readers.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Eradicating Conception of Confrontation
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Eradicating Conception of Confrontation
 Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- The conception of confrontation dating back to the old era should be eradicated to achieve the cause of national reunification by implementing the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, urges Rodong Sinmun Monday in a signed article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The conception of confrontation with fellow countrymen is, in a nutshell, a product of the moves of outside forces to split and alienate the Korean nation, a scenario for aggression, aimed to infringe upon the sovereignty of the Korean nation and dominate the whole of Korea.
					
					 There is no reason whatsoever to insist on the old conception of confrontation at present.
					
					 If Koreans miss the chance and hesitate to take any action, obsessed with the conception of confrontation, the north and the south will neither get reconciled nor united. If the situation is allowed to go on, the tension will escalate and invite even a national disaster in the end. Without eradicating the conception of confrontation is it impossible to improve the inter-Korean relations nor is it possible to achieve peace and the reunification of the country. 
					
					 If the deep-rooted conception of confrontation is to be done away with in south Korea it is necessary to have an attitude of respecting and accepting "By our nation itself," an idea of independence and unity, as an idea of reunification common to the nation. One should not pay lip-service to improved north-south relations but accept the idea of "By our nation itself" as a genuine patriotic idea and work in the direction of national reconciliation and unity, guided by it. 
					
					 The north and the south have valuable experience of having achieved concord and unity, guided by the idea of "By our nation itself" in line with the spirit of the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and improved the inter-Korean relations and advanced the cause of national reunification. 
					
					 When Koreans handle all the problems in the spirit of "By our nation itself," bravely doing away with the old idea of confrontation, there will be an epochal turn in the work for improving the north-south relations and accomplishing the cause of national reunification.

articles.title: Iran-DPRK Friendly Meeting Held
articles.content:
Iran-DPRK Friendly Meeting Held
 Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- A friendly meeting took place on the Iran-Korea Friendship Magsal Agro-Stock Farm on Oct. 13 on the occasion of the week of Iran-DPRK friendship.
					 Attending it were the manager and employees of the farm.
					
					 Present there on invitation were the DPRK ambassador to Iran and his embassy officials and members of the friendly delegation of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries.
					
					 Speeches were made at the meeting.
					
					 Its participants watched Korean film "The Faith of Korea" and had sports and amusement games, deepening friendship.

articles.title: Overseas Compatriots Call for Implementation of Inter-Korean Declarations
articles.content:
Overseas Compatriots Call for Implementation of Inter-Korean Declarations
 Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- A meeting of overseas Koreans was held in Tokyo on Oct. 16 to vow to defend and implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.
					 Attending it were representatives of the Japan Regional Committee under the Overseas Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration and overseas compatriots' organizations in the United States, Europe, Canada and other parts of the world and Korean residents of different strata in Japan.
					
					 Introduced at the meeting were congratulatory messages from the North and South Side Committees for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration, the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification and organizations of overseas compatriots in different countries.
					
					 Ho Jong Man, chief vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), made a congratulatory speech there.
					
					 He said that it has been proven by history that the June 15 joint declaration is a great programme for national reunification and the October 4 declaration is an action programme for developing the north-south relations and achieving peace and co-prosperity of the nation.
					
					Noting that the north-south relations have witnessed a new turning phase recently thanks to General Secretary Kim Jong Il's bold decision and wise guidance, he stressed that Chongryon and Korean residents in Japan together with all other overseas compatriots in the world would as ever creditably discharge their duty in the struggle for national reunification under the banner of "By our nation itself" full of indomitable fighting spirit and confidence that remaining faithful to Kim Jong Il's leadership guarantees the national dignity and happiness of the compatriots and posterity.
					
					 Kwak Tong Ui, co-chairman of the Overseas Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration, made a report at the meeting.
					
					 Saying that next year will mark the 10th anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration, the reporter called upon the overseas Koreans to do their utmost for the independent reunification of the country and the eternal prosperity of the nation, mindful that genuine patriotism is manifested in devoting oneself to national reunification.
					
					 The floor was taken by Yang Un Sik, permanent chairman of the U.S. Regional Committee, Ri Hui Se, permanent representative of the European Regional Committee, and Jong Hwak Phil, chairman of the Canadian Regional Committee.
					
					 Then the attendants listened to a solidarity letter to the meeting from Haruki Wata, honorary professor at Tokyo University. 
					
					 Read out at the meeting was a resolution titled "Let us open the gate to national reunification by defending and implementing the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration!"
					
					 Adopted at the meeting was a special statement "The Japanese authorities should sincerely apologize to the Korean nation for Japan's past crimes and redeem them".
					
					 At the end of the meeting, there was a cultural and art evening of overseas Koreans.
					
					 That day the participants of the meeting visited the Korean Hall of Chongryon.

articles.title: Seminars Held in Different Countries
articles.content:
Seminars Held in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- Seminars were held in Italy, Mexico and Mongolia between October 5 and 8 to commemorate the 64th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the 83rd formation anniversary of the Down-with-Imperialism Union (DIU).
					Reports and speeches were made there.
					
					 Osvaldo Pesce, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Unified Communist Party of Italy, said that General Secretary Kim Jong Il made the WPK hold higher the banner of the idea of Songun, the idea of giving importance to the army. By doing so, he has led the party to demonstrate its might as the guiding force for the cause of Songun that firmly defends its revolutionary and anti-imperialist independent characters and achieves the victory of socialism with arms, the speaker added.
					
					 Ramon Jimenez Lopez, president of the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism, noted that the WPK tracing its origin back to the DIU formed by President Kim Il Sung has led the revolutionary struggle and construction work under the banner of independence, the banner of Juche and the banner of Songun for more than six decades.
					
					 Under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il the WPK is guiding the people to the future with responsibility for their destiny as the mother party, a mass party that realized the integrated whole of the leader, the party and the mass, he stressed.
					
					 The executive chairman of the Mongolian Association for the Study of Juche Idea-Songun Idea said that the reality of the DPRK proves that one can develop when one depends on one's own strength. The DPRK's achievements are ascribable to the correct ideas and theories and the wise leadership, he added.

articles.title: Centenary of Birth of Kim Il Sung to Be Commemorated in Uganda
articles.content:
Centenary of Birth of Kim Il Sung to Be Commemorated in Uganda
 Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- A Ugandan preparatory committee was inaugurated with due ceremony in Kampala on October 6 to commemorate the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Kirunda Kivejinja, third deputy prime minister and minister of Internal Affairs, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee at the ceremony.

articles.title: Officials Should Mix Themselves with People
articles.content:
Officials Should Mix Themselves with People
 Pyongyang, October 19 (KCNA) -- It was one day in March Juche 48 (1959). President Kim Il Sung was on the way to give field guidance to then Sonbong County, North Hamgyong Province. Seeing a lake through the car window, he got the driver to stop the car.
					 He got off the car and asked the local officials about their plan of using the lake, fishes inhabiting there and its bed conditions.
					
					 Having no knowledge about them, they were bewildered.
					
					 At that moment he noticed villagers standing on roadside to greet him and called them to him.
					
					 The President asked an old man how long he had lived there and how the people there had lived.
					
					 After listening to him, the President inquired what kinds of fishes were living in the lake.
					
					 The old man and other villagers told him about the history of the lake and the species of fishes living there as they knew.
					
					 After listening to them, he slowly walked on the lake-shore and stared at the calm surface of the lake. Then, he asked them again about how deep the lake was and why its water was muddy.
					
					 An old man explained that the bed of the lake was covered with sand and mud and the water became muddy with the flow of the Tuman River water into it, as well as its depth.
					
					 The President earnestly admonished the officials, saying: If you have something to know, you should go among people. This will lead you to learn it.
					
					 The lifetime motto of the President that "The people are my God" will be conveyed long along with this story.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il presencia funcion de conjunto artistico de Rusia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il presencia funcion de conjunto artistico de Rusia
Pyongyang, 19 de octubre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, presencio el dia 17 junto con los oficiales y soldados del EPC la funcion del Conjunto Artistico Academico de la Unidad del Ministerio del Interior de Rusia, de visita en Corea.
					Le acogieron en el teatro el director del conjunto artistico Viktor Yeliseev, el embajador Valery Sukhinin y otros diplomaticos oficiales de la embajada rusa en Corea.
					
					 El Dirigente dio calurosa bienvenida a la visita del conjunto artistico a Corea y departio cordialmente con los huespedes tras darles agradecimiento por haber dado alegria al ejercito y el pueblo de Corea que celebraron el 64o aniversario de la fundacion del PTC a traves de la energica funcion en el centro y localidad.
					
					Cuando aparecio el Dirigente en el palco principal del teatro, todos los espectadores le dieron calida bienvenida.
					
					Le acompanaron en ver la funcion los secretarios Choe Thae Bok y Kim Ki Nam, los jefes y primeros subjefes de departamento y otros cuadros directivos, del CC del PTC, el ministro de Seguridad del Pueblo Ju Sang Song, el primer vicecanciller Kang Sok Ju, los generales de ejercito del EPC Hyon Chol Hae y Ri Myong Su y otros miembros directivos del ejercito.
					
					Los artistas rusos iniciaron la funcion con la "Cancion del General Kim Il Sung" y pusieron en la escena el solo masculino y coro "Regrese a Sorento", el solo femenino y coro "Viendo el lago azul", la "Danza de fiesta rusa", la cancion coreana "Mi vida bendita", el solo masculino y coro "Amigos eternos de Corea y Rusia" creados especialmente para la visita a Corea  y otras piezas.
					
					A traves de la funcion, los ejecutantes mostraron vividamente con alto talento artistico el ferviente patriotismo, la vida romantica y el sentimiento nacional del ejercito y el pueblo de Rusia.
					
					   La funcion fue terminada por la "Cancion del General Kim Jong Il".
					
					El Dirigente envio un cesto de flores a los ejecutantes felicitandoles por exitos de su funcion.

articles.title: Canciller coreano felicita a la directora general de UNESCO
articles.content:
Canciller coreano felicita a la directora general de UNESCO
Pyongyang, 19 de octubre (ATCC) -- El ministro de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Pak Ui Chun, envio el dia 16 un mensaje de felicitacion a Irina Gueorguieva Bokova por su eleccion como directora general de la Organizacion de las Naciones Unidas para la Educacion, la Ciencia y la Cultura (UNESCO) en el 35o periodo de sesiones de la asamblea general de la misma.
					  En la misiva el remitente desea a la destinataria exitos en su labor responsable y expresa la conviccion de que se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran mas las relaciones de cooperacion entre la RPDC y la UNESCO.

articles.title: Firmado convenio entre Wonsan y Vladivostok
articles.content:
Firmado convenio entre Wonsan y Vladivostok
Pyongyang, 19 de octubre (ATCC) -- Quedo rubricado el dia 19 en Wonsan el convenio sobre el establecimiento de las relaciones hermanas y el fortalecimiento de la amistad y cooperacion entre la ciudad de Wonsan de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la de Vladivostok de la Federacion Rusa.
					  En la ocasion estuvieron presentes, por la parte coreana, la presidenta de la Asociacion de Amistad Corea-Rusia y vicepresidenta del Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero, Hong Son Ok, el presidente del Comite Popular de la Ciudad de Wonsan, Ri Il Sop y otros funcionarios y, por la rusa, la delegacion de la ciudad de Vladivostok de la Federacion Rusa encabezada por el alcalde Igor Pushkarev, y el ministro-consejero de la embajada rusa en Corea, Alexander Matsegora.

articles.title: Fotoexposicion y ceremonia de donacion de libros rusos
articles.content:
Fotoexposicion y ceremonia de donacion de libros rusos
 Pyongyang, 19 de octubre (ATCC) -- Con motivo de la firma del convenio sobre el establecimiento de las relaciones hermanas y el fortalecimiento de la amistad y cooperacion entre la ciudad de Wonsan de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la de Vladivostok de la Federacion Rusa tuvieron lugar el dia 19 en la Exposicion Permanente de Bellas Artes de la provincia de Kangwon la exposicion de fotos de la ciudad de Vladivostok y la ceremonia de donacion de libros rusos.
					  En la ocasion estuvieron presentes la presidenta de la Asociacion de Amistad Corea-Rusia y  vicepresidenta del Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero Hong Son Ok, el presidente del Comite Popular de la Ciudad de Wonsan Ri Il Sop, y otros funcionarios, asi como trabajadores de esta urbe.
					
					  Tambien participaron la delegacion de la ciudad de Vladivostok de la Federacion Rusa encabezada por el alcalde, Igor Pushkarev, y el ministro-consejero de la embajada rusa en Corea, Alexander Matsegora.
					
					  Tras escuchar los discursos, los participantes vieron las fotos que dan a conocer dicha ciudad rusa.
					
					  Seguidamente, fueron donados los libros rusos a la Universidad de Agricultura de Wonsan.

articles.title: Firmado protocolo de intercambio deportivo entre Corea y China
articles.content:
Firmado protocolo de intercambio deportivo entre Corea y China
Pyongyang, 19 de octubre (ATCC) -- Quedo rubricado el dia 17 en China el protocolo de intercambio deportivo para el ano 2010 entre el Comite de Direccion de Deportes de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Administracion General Estatal de Deportes de la Republica Popular China.
					En la ceremonia de firmas estuvieron presentes, por la parte coreana, los miembros de la delegacion de dicho comite presidida por su presidente Pak Hak Son, y por la china, el ministro de la entidad china Liu Peng y otros funcionarios.
					
					Pak Hak Son y Liu Peng suscribieron el documento.
